intro: Cirrhopetalum trigonopus, commonly known as the three-angled cirrhopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Cirrhopetalaceae, which is a small family of flowering plants primarily found in the Southern Hemisphere. The plant is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
